intro: Moehringia trinervia var. pentandra, commonly known as the five-veined moehringia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and have a distinct five-veined structure, which is a key identifying feature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. The plant produces pink or white flowers that bloom in early to mid-summer, adding delicate beauty to its habitat.
